abstract: The 2-to-1 opinion said the search engines could be held liable for defamation only if they were made aware of clearly illegal content and were negligent in removing it.
snippet: The 2-to-1 opinion said the search engines could be held liable for defamation only if they were made aware of clearly illegal content and were negligent in removing it.
lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES — In a rare victory for Google and Yahoo Argentina, an appeals court has cleared the companies of defamation for including sex-related Web sites in their search results for an Argentine entertainer.

headline.main: Google and Yahoo Win Appeal in Argentine Case
headline.print_headline: Google and Yahoo Win Appeal in Argentine Case

abstract: Latin America is a hodgepodge of laws regarding the liability of Internet companies for third-party content.
snippet: Latin America is a hodgepodge of laws regarding the liability of Internet companies for third-party content.
lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES – Google and Yahoo won an appeal of a lawsuit brought by an Argentine entertainer, Virginia Da Cunha. Her name and some photos showed up in search results connected with sex sites. The appeals court ruled Google and Yahoo weren’t liable for defamation for third-party content.
